IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PREPARE BOYS FOR COLLEGE AND LIFE
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE KISKI SCHOOL IS TO PREPARE YOUNG MEN TO SUCCEED IN COLLEGE AND IN LIFE.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION - TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION TO STUDENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: STUDENT ACTIVITIES - TO PROVIDE EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES FOR STUDENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: FOOD SERVICE - TO PROVIDE FOOD SERVICE FOR STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAXES IN ACCORDANCE WITH AUTHORITATIVE GUIDANCE, WHICH PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITY. MEASUREMENT OF THE TAX UNCERTAINTY OCCURS IF THE RECOGNITION THRESHOLD HAS BEEN MET. THE SCHOOL'S FEDERAL EXEMPT ORGANIZATION BUSINESS INCOME TAX RETURNS FOR 2015, 2014, AND 2013 REMAIN SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS.
STUDENT AID 3,879,578. COST OF BOOKSTORE AND SPECIAL SERVICES 373,270.
RESTRICTED EXPENSES 5,648,269. COST OF BOOKSTORE AND SPECIAL SERVICES 373,270. STUDENT AID 3,879,576.

IN ACCORDANCE WITH SFAS 116, THE SCHOOL RECEIVES COLLECTIONS WHICH ARE HELD FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION AND EDUCATION IN FURTHERANCE OF PUBLIC SERVICE RATHER THAN FINANCIAL GAIN. THESE COLLECTIONS, WHICH ARE PROTECTED AND PRESERVED BY THE SCHOOL, ARE NOT RECORDED AS REVENUE AND ARE NOT RECORDED AS AN ASSET ON THE BALANCE SHEET.
KISKI PUBLICIZES ITS NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY THROUGH ITS ENROLLMENT AND ADVERTISING MATERIALS BUT NOT THROUGH NEWSPAPER OR BROADCAST MEDIA.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: ENROLL INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS TO ATTEND HIGH SCHOOL IN AMERICA
ENROLL INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS TO ATTEND HIGH SCHOOL IN AMERICA

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: NORTH AMERICA - CANADA AND MEXICO, BUT NOT THE UNITED STATES
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: ENROLL INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS TO ATTEND HIGH SCHOOL IN AMERICA

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.ValuationMethodUsedDesc: AWARDED THROUGH NORMAL FINANCIAL AID PROCESS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MONITORS THE USE OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL BUDGETED TO ACTUAL FINANCIAL AID ACTIVITIES IS MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND THE FINANCIAL AID FOR EACH STUDENT IS APPROVED PRIOR TO DISBURSING FUNDS. FINANCIAL AID REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE ARE MONITORED BY BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE ACCURACY.

FundraiserActivityInfoGrp.ActivityTxt: CONSULT WITH SCHOOL ON FUNDRAISING STRATEGY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MONITORS THE USE OF FINANCIAL AID FUNDS THROUGH A SHARED APPROACH BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL BUDGETED TO ACTUAL FINANCIAL AID ACTIVITY IS MONITORED ON A MONTHLY BASIS AND THE FINANCIAL AID FOR EACH STUDENT IS APPROVED PRIOR TO DISBURSING FUNDS. FINANCIAL AID REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE ARE MONITORED BY BOTH THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO ENSURE ACCURACY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS REVIEWED THE FORM 990 AND DISCUSSED VIA CONFERENCE CALL. THE ENTIRE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WAS SENT A FINAL VERSION OF THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH TRUSTEE AND OFFICER IS REQUIRED TO SIGN AN ANNUAL STATEMENT DISCLOSING THAT THEY HAVE READ THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND ARE IN AGREEMENT WITH IT. IN ADDITION, PERIODIC REVIEWS OF TRANSACTIONS SUCH AS COMPENSATION, BENEFITS, AND PARTNERSHIP TRANSACTIONS ARE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS' POLICIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HEADMASTER'S COMPENSATION WAS LAST DETERMINED IN FISCAL 2015. THE COMPENSATION AMOUNT WAS REVIEWED AND DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE BASED UPON DISCUSSIONS WITH OTHER MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND COMPARABLE DATA. THIS DETERMINATION WAS DOCUMENTED IN A FORMAL EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT AND BOARD MINUTES. THE SALARIES OF OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES ARE ALSO DETERMINED IN A REVIEW BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE LAST REVIEW WAS IN FISCAL 2016.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
THERE WERE NO CHANGES IN THIS PROCESS FOR 2015-2016
60,412 CHANGE IN VALUE OF TRUST 625,182 UNREALIZED LOSS 685,594 TOTAL UNREALIZED LOSS ON INVESTMENTS
